required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of NVP-1203 and NVP-1203-R in Patients With Acute Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Active Controlled, Parallel, Multicenter, Phase 3 Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of NVP-1203 in Patients With Acute Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety NVP-1203 in patients with acute low back pain.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomized, double-blind, active-controlled, parallel, phase 3 study to evaluate efficacy and safety of NVP-1203 in patients with acute low back pain.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in pain intensity assessed by Visual Analogue Scale(VAS)
primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity is assessed by 100 mm Visual Analogue Scale(VAS) (0 mm = no pain and 100 mm = maximum pain) evaluated from baseline to Day 7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in pain intensity assessed by Visual Analogue Scale(VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity is assessed by 100 mm Visual Analogue Scale(VAS) (0 mm = no pain and 100 mm = maximum pain) evaluated from baseline to Day 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Finger to Floor Distance(FFD)
secondary_outcome.description: FFD is measured by the Investigators who will ask the patients to bend forward and try to touch the floor with the fingers. The distance between the finger to the floor is measured in cm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Oswestry Disability Index(ODI)
secondary_outcome.description: The questionnaire consists of 10 items with each item having 6 answers associated to activities of daily living. The ODI score range is 0 to 100% (low score: minimal disability, high score: bed-bound or exaggerating)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Physician's Global Assessment of Response to Therapy(PGART)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's response of change after administration is assessed on 5-point rating scales(very poor, poor, no change, good and very good).

arm_group.description: NVP-1203 plus NVP-1203-R placebo for up to 7 days, oral dose
NVP-1203-R plus NVP-1203 placebo for up to 7 days, oral dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have ability to comprehend the contents of study and before participating in trial and have willingness to sign of informed consent in writing
- Subjects who have symptom of acute low back pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who cannot prohibit anti-inflammatory drug or muscle relaxants during clinical trial
- Inadequate subject for the clinical trial by the investigator's decision
